tcppBridge.hpp
1#pragma once
2
3#include "tcppBridgeFunc.hpp"
4#include "marshaling/tgenericMarshaling.hpp"
5#include "../../ast/obj.hpp"
6#include "../../type/mgdType.hpp"

8namespace namu {
9
14 template <typename T, typename S = obj>
15 class tcppBridge : public S {
16 // TODO: how to impement 'as()' on bridge obj:
17 // each tcppBridge obj has its unique type object. when it got called 'getType()'
18 // it returns its type object.
19 //
20 // however, type object is dynamically belongs to this bridge object, when user
21 // tries to get ttype<T>, it's not derived from ntype so it won't have any 'as()'
22 // func. user can't operate conversion in this way.
23 NAMU(CLASS(tcppBridge, S))
24 template <typename Ret, typename T1, typename S1, template <typename, typename, nbool> class Marshaling, typename...Args>
25 friend class tcppBridgeFunc;
26
27 public:
28 tcppBridge(): super(new mgdType(ttype<T>::get().getName())), _real(nullptr) {
29 _subs.bind(new scope());
30 }
31 tcppBridge(T* real): super(new mgdType(ttype<T>::get().getName())), _real(real) {
32 _subs.bind(new scope());
33 }
34
35 public:
36 static me* def() {
37 // TODO: need to handle ctor with argument.
38 return new me(new T());
39 }
40
41 using super::subs;
42 nbicontainer& subs() override { return *_subs; }
43
44 template <typename Ret, typename... Args>
45 me* func(const std::string& name, Ret(T::*fptr)(Args...)) {
46 subs().add(name, new tcppBridgeFunc<Ret, T, S, tmarshaling, Args...>(fptr));
47 return this;
48 }
49 template <typename Ret, typename... Args>
50 me* func(const std::string& name, Ret(T::*fptr)(Args...) const) {
51 subs().add(name, new tcppBridgeFunc<Ret, T, S, tmarshaling, Args...>( (Ret(T::*)(Args...)) fptr));
52 return this;
53 }
54
55 T& get() { return *_real; }
56 const T& get() const { return *_real; }
57
58 const obj& getOrigin() const override {
59 // if an object doesn't have owned sub nodes it means that all instances of that classes
60 // are same and origin simulteneously.
61 return *this;
62 }
63
64 // TODO: add defaultCtor, defaultCopyCtor
65
66 private:
67 T* _real;
68 tstr<scope> _subs;
69 };
70}
